stateCompliance.headline: Understanding California Cash Advance Laws in San Diego
stateCompliance.content: San Diego residents benefit from California's robust consumer protections. The DFPI strictly regulates cash advance lenders to prevent predatory lending.
keyPoints: Maximum loan amount is $300 including all fees
Maximum fee is 15% of check amount (approximately 460% APR)
Only one loan allowed at a time - no rollovers
Lion Cash Advance is DFPI licensed and compliant
Maximum one $15 NSF fee per bounced check
All disclosures must be in writing in your language
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI)
stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is for general guidance only. California payday loan regulations are subject to change. For current information, contact the DFPI at 1-866-275-2677 or visit dfpi.ca.gov. Consult a California attorney for specific legal questions.

nearbyLocations.headline: Also Serving Nearby San Diego County Cities
nearbyLocations.intro: Need a location closer to you? We serve these nearby San Diego communities:

faq.question: Where is your San Diego location located?
faq.answer: We're at 789 Harbor Drive, Suite 200, right across from USS Midway Museum in downtown San Diego. Take I-5 to Exit 16 and follow Harbor Drive. Easy parking nearby.

faq.question: Can I get approved same-day in San Diego?
faq.answer: Yes! Visit our Harbor Drive location with a valid ID, proof of income, and checking account information. Most San Diego customers receive same-day approval and funding.

faq.question: What fees do you charge for cash advances in California?
faq.answer: California limits fees to 15% of the loan amount. For a $200 loan, the fee is $30. For $255, the maximum fee is $45.

faq.question: What documents do I need at the San Diego branch?
faq.answer: Bring a valid government-issued ID, recent pay stubs or proof of income, and banking information. The process takes about 30 minutes.

faq.question: Is Lion Cash Advance properly licensed in California?
faq.answer: Yes, we are fully licensed by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation. Verify our license at dfpi.ca.gov/regulated-industries/regulated-entities-list/
